text: what is sugar sugar is a combination of
three molecules these three molecules
are essential to feeding animals they
are not essential to feeding us these
three molecules are glucose fructose and
galactose now they will appear in food
as combinations of any one of those
three put together the combination of
glucose and fructose is called sucrose
that's cane sugar table sugar beet sugar
the stuff you put in your coffee when
you put glucose with galactose you get
lactose or milk sugar and that of course
is what you find in dairy products so
different kinds of sugar will be found
in different kinds of foods the question
is what detriments could any of these do
glucose is the energy of life every cell
on the planet burns glucose for energy
glucose is so important that if you
don't consume it your body makes it now
fructose is the sweet molecule high
fructose corn syrup or agave or maple
syrup or honey these are our caloric
sweeteners and they all have one
molecule glucose and one molecule of
fructose fructose is the molecule that
we seek fructose is the molecule that
makes sugar pleasurable so also the
molecule that makes sugar addictive
turns out there is no biochemical
reaction in the body that requires it it
is completely vestigial and when
consumed in excess it causes cellular
metabolic human damage and death in fact
fructose is metabolized in the liver
exactly like alcohol and that is why
children today are getting the diseases
of alcohol without alcohol because we
just gave them a substitute
